metadata.title: CVE-2022-23221 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
H2 Console before 2.1.210 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary codevia a jdbc:h2:mem JDBC URL containing theIGNORE_UNKNOWN_SETTINGS=TRUE;FORBID_CREATION=FALSE;INIT=RUNSCRIPTsubstring, a different vulnerability than CVE-2021-42392.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-23221` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libh2-java - 1.4.191-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: h2database package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.191-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
